intro: Nuttallia springeri, commonly known as the springer's nuttallia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually small and pale greenish-white, with a distinctive two-lipped structure. Nuttallia springeri is often found in open woodlands and scrub habitats, contributing to local biodiversity.
